Title: Manufacturing Data Analyst
Description:
Who is Litens?

We are a diverse group of talented people committed to creating solutions to problems and making the world a better place. We enhance and deliver both mechanical and electrified solutions that bring efficiency and sustainability to new heights. Founded in 1979, Litens has a proud history of being an innovative and highly respected company specializing in powertrain system engineering and component supply. Our history includes numerous achievements, many of which have been recognized through prestigious awards from our customers.

Experience a fulfilling and supportive environment where ingenuity is rewarded, collaboration is encouraged, and opportunities are readily available.




Why Join Litens?

Join the Litens Manufacturing Operations Team as a Manufacturing Improvement Analyst. At Litens, you can make an impact. We’ve purposefully cultivated a supportive and flexible environment that gives everyone the opportunity to succeed. Litens offers a competitive and people-first approach to compensation and benefits, and we are committed to provide balanced employment and advancement opportunities for everyone.

Our diversity is our source of strength. At Litens, we are committed to equal employment opportunity, and we value and welcome diversity. We respect employees’ rights for a safe and respectful workplace. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.




What will you do?

Gather and diagnose historical Manufacturing data from various sources related to Process, Materials, Labour, or Overhead and present opportunities for improvement.
Maintain status of labour, NVA, and scrap costs for monthly reconciliation with accounting
Monitor Shoplogix MES data and work with Business Systems/IT/Production to maintain accuracy and integrity
Balance support towards evaluation, research, and analysis between shop floor and office processes
Benchmark current business practices against World Class processes and present opportunities to management for improvement
Monitor Work Center performance to expected standards and communicate any variances to production leadership and Lean Manager
Participate and support CI related activities (kaizen, VSM, Materials PFEP, CI projects) by supplying performance data and hands on practical assistance.
Leverage your expert Excel skills for analysis of Manufacturing Operations data and potential improvement
Provides performance data for bench marking exercises within Litens global facilities.
Manage and maintain annual changes to Litens Production System Assessment (LPSA)
Work with Maintenance and Setup teams and leaders to facilitate administrative machine related Preventative Maintenance improvements




What will you bring?

University degree in Business or Engineering
4 years automotive/manufacturing experience
Proven ability to navigate, gather and analyze data through various business systems such as MS D365 Finance and Operations, and others, with a high degree of competence
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, intermediate skills with Word and Power Point
Proven ability to diagnose manufacturing data for the purpose of identifying and quantifying business opportunities and propose alternative improvement solutions
Requirement to maintain confidentiality is critical to this role
Experience with Lean Manufacturing principles and concepts
Flexible to work between local plants if necessary

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Location Address: Hybrid (minimum once a week) – 44 King Street W 23rd Floor

Contract Duration: ASAP until October 31, 2024

Extension Opportunity: Yes

Scheduled Hours: Monday to Friday, 8:30 am-5 pm




Story Behind the Need:

The Data Analyst, Data Remediation Audit Program contributes to the overall success of the Group Treasury Data Office in Canada ensuring specific individual goals, plans and initiatives are executed/delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives.




The main function of the Data Analyst role is to support the investigation, development, testing and operationalization of data solutions related to the strategic goals of the Group Treasury Data Office. This role ensures all activities are conducted in compliance with enterprise data standards, policies and procedures. This project entails a three-year road map from 2024 to 2026, an extension opportunity is available for the candidates.




Candidate Value Proposition:

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work within the Bank. We are data partners that support technology and business around the world. You will get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology.




Typical Day in Role:

Support the Senior Manager on strategic data and innovation initiatives, presentations, and analysis with executive-level visibility for the Treasury Management team.
Experience working in data management and can provide hands-on support on the implementation according to Data Office playbooks, guidelines, standards, and policies (e.g., documenting initiatives, use cases, data tiering and classification, critical data elements, and business data elements).
Performs necessary data mapping and lineage activities and documents information flows to support specific business requirements.
Performs data quality rule creation, and analyzes and communicates results supporting data quality processes.
Builds the metadata model and business glossary by gathering information from multiple sources: business users, existing data sources, databases and other relevant documents and systems.




Candidate Requirements/Must-Have Skills:

1. 10+ years of working experience as a Data Analyst with a strong understanding of data concepts (metadata, data mapping, data quality, data modeling, data governance).

2. Hands-on experience working within Data Management and Operations, including proficiency in Data Management Tools (Collibra and IGC preferred) and understanding of data flows within a large enterprise.

3. Working knowledge of Data Management framework and can trace data elements at origination and as they move between systems including any transformations.

4. Working knowledge of data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules using IGC (Information Governance Console) and universal catalogue.

5. Hands-on experience with developing dashboards in PowerBI and Tableau.




Nice-To-Have Skills:

Strong business acumen, data analysis, metadata documentation, and data quality controls skills specifically with respect to analyzing business process controls, sourcing, and provisioning of lineage, identifying data quality issues and proposing remediation steps.
Understanding of Bank’s systems i.e. ALM6, IGC, GC.
Demonstrated ability to provide evidence to 2nd and 3rd line.
Understanding or experience with Treasury.
Cloud platforms and related data services knowledge (e.g., Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services).




Best vs. Average Candidate:

An average candidate will only have experience with data governance, whereas the ideal candidate will have expertise in both data governance and data analytics.
Extensive experience with Power BI and Tableau.
Detail-oriented and ability to work independently.




Education:

Strong technical education background, majoring in fields that require a high degree of analytical skills, such as Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math, Statistics, Accounting or related field.

Title: Associate Data Scientist
Description:
JOIN OUR TEAM!

At Circle K, our mission is simple: to make our customer’s lives a little easier everyday. You may have already stopped for coffee, refueling your car, or eating something on the go. Then, you know what Couche-Tard/Circle K is. We have grown into a successful global company with over 16,000 stores in 29 countries, serving almost 9 million customers every day. In total, more than 150,000 people work in our stores and offices. We make journeys easier by offering fast and friendly service. We care about our people and our communities, and we look for ways to uplift people first. Wherever your journey’s going, we can help you get there.   Are you ready to grow your career? Let's grow together!

Associate Data Scientist

_________________________________________________________________________________

Department: Global Data & Analytics

Location: Toronto, ON (305 Milner Ave, Suite 400, M1B 3V4)

Hybrid work: 3 days at the office and 2 days remotely

Type of employment: Permanent, Full Time (40 hours)

_________________________________________________________________________________

THE ROLE

As a member of the Enterprise Data & Analytics Team, the Data Scientist is an everyday partner with multiple departments, including Global Marketing, Category Management, Shared Services & Finance, Global Technology, and Business Unit Leadership. This is a unique opportunity to work on a new, growing team within a large organization.

The Data Scientist is responsible for delivering advanced analytics projects that drive business results. The ideal candidate should possess the ability to contribute to all aspects of project work, including interpreting business questions and desired outcomes, selecting the appropriate methodology, data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, model building, and creation of polished deliverables that are suitable for internal and external presentation.

We are looking for an individual who is a proven problem solver with exceptional critical thinking ability. The candidate should have a high sense of curiosity and be comfortable with ambiguity when faced with a difficult challenge. Additionally, the candidate should possess the abilities to collaborate with others and simply and effectively communicate complex concepts with a non-technical audience.

What You’ll Do

Excited to embark on a journey with us? Here's a breakdown of the key responsibilities in this role:


Develop advanced analytics and predictive models from design through implementation in the areas of pricing and promotion, marketing, merchandising, and other areas of the business as needed
Participate in the research of analytical methods to find or advance solutions to business problems
Clearly and concisely explain complex analytical findings to non-analytical peers and business leaders
Create analytic datasets in collaboration with data engineering teams that involves data querying, cleaning, transformation, and feature engineering. Define requirements and test cases for Data validation and monitoring
Author programming code (e.g., SQL, Python, R, spark) to assemble and analyze data, following/establishing/enhancing organizational standards and coding practices including code management (i.e. Documentation, use of Git Hub). Lead and participate in peer code reviews for QA/QC/standards compliance.
Train/Mentor other team members, provide developmental support where necessary
Follow defined project management processes. Actively participate in project plan development and agile ceremonies (development of backlog, sprint planning, daily standups, retros/reviews) and documentation.


What You’ll Need

We want you to join our team! Here's what we're looking for:

Knowledge And Skills


Demonstrated knowledge of SQL, R and Python;
Experience querying large datasets using SparkSQL or PySpark;
Experience with ML frameworks such as scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch, etc.;
Exposure with software development practices, object-oriented principles and test automation;
Exposure to version control systems such as Git – experience preferred
Experience with cloud-based analytics environments (Azure, AWS or GCP);
Experience applying operational research, statistical and machine learning techniques such as regression, time series forecasting, clustering, optimization, etc.;
Exposure to agile methodologies using project planning and tracking management tools e.g., JIRA; experience preferred
Strong problem-solving skills including problem spotting and problem scoping;
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate the business benefits of analytics;
Availability to travel up to 10% of the time


Education


Bachelor’s degree required, preferably with a quantitative focus (Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, Math, Economics, etc.)
Master’s degree preferred
Internships / experience in data science or related roles preferred
Masters degree / Bachelors + internship experience in a data science/advanced analytics role, or demonstrated ability to perform job functions via academic project/internship experience


Why You Should Work Here

At Couche-Tard/Circle K, we believe that our team members are the heart and soul of our business. When you join us, you're not just getting a job – you're becoming part of a vibrant community where your talents are valued, your growth is nurtured, and your contributions make a real difference. Here's why you'll love working with us:

Benefits Package


Group Insurance Program: Stay healthy and happy! Our plan provides you with the flexibility to choose coverage that best meets your needs and add optional insurance (health and dental care, long-term disability, life insurance, health spending account)
Pension Plan: Plan for your future and retire with peace of mind with our pension plan, helping you build a secure financial future.
Share Purchase Plan: Invest in your future and share in our success with our employee stock purchase plan, allowing you to become a shareholder of Circle K.
Paid Time Off: Recharge and rejuvenate with paid time off, including vacation days, sick days, and personal days to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance.


Additional Perks


Training and Development: Grow your skills and advance your career with access to ongoing training and development opportunities, including workshops, seminars, and online courses.
Recognition and Rewards: We celebrate our team's achievements and milestones with a range of recognition programs, rewards, and incentives to show our appreciation for your hard work and dedication.
Mentorship Program: Take your career to new heights with our mentorship program, where seasoned professionals provide guidance, support, and valuable insights to help you reach your full potential.
Scholarship Program: Invest in your education and future success with our scholarship program, available not only to our employees but also to their children. We're committed to supporting your lifelong learning journey and empowering you to achieve your academic and career goals.


INTERESTED? You are only a few clicks away from joining an exceptional company! Visit our careers page at https://workwithus.circlek.com/ca/en to submit your application. We can't wait to hear from you!

At Circle K, we're committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone is treated with respect and dignity. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life to join our team and contribute their unique perspectives and talents.

We thank all candidates for their interest in this position. Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted for further steps in the hiring process.

Circle K values diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from the following designated groups: women, aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request in all aspects of the selection process.

The candidate should have a high sense of curiosity and be comfortable with ambiguity when faced with a difficult challenge. Additionally, the candidate should possess the abilities to collaborate with others and simply and effectively communicate complex concepts with a non-technical audience.

What You’ll Do

Excited to embark on a journey with us? Here's a breakdown of the key responsibilities in this role:

  • Develop advanced analytics and predictive models from design through implementation in the areas of pricing and promotion, marketing, merchandising, and other areas of the business as needed
  • Participate in the research of analytical methods to find or advance solutions to business problems
  • Clearly and concisely explain complex analytical findings to non-analytical peers and business leaders
  • Create analytic datasets in collaboration with data engineering teams that involves data querying, cleaning, transformation, and feature engineering. Define requirements and test cases for Data validation and monitoring
  • Author programming code (e.g., SQL, Python, R, spark) to assemble and analyze data, following/establishing/enhancing organizational standards and coding practices including code management (i.e. Documentation, use of Git Hub). Lead and participate in peer code reviews for QA/QC/standards compliance.
  • Train/Mentor other team members, provide developmental support where necessary
  • Follow defined project management processes. Actively participate in project plan development and agile ceremonies (development of backlog, sprint planning, daily standups, retros/reviews) and documentation.

What You’ll Need

We want you to join our team! Here's what we're looking for:

Knowledge And Skills

  • Demonstrated knowledge of SQL, R and Python;
  • Experience querying large datasets using SparkSQL or PySpark;
  • Experience with ML frameworks such as scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch, etc.;
  • Exposure with software development practices, object-oriented principles and test automation;
  • Exposure to version control systems such as Git – experience preferred
  • Experience with cloud-based analytics environments (Azure, AWS or GCP);
  • Experience applying operational research, statistical and machine learning techniques such as regression, time series forecasting, clustering, optimization, etc.;
  • Exposure to agile methodologies using project planning and tracking management tools e.g., JIRA; experience preferred
  • Strong problem-solving skills including problem spotting and problem scoping;
  • Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate the business benefits of analytics;
  • Availability to travel up to 10% of the time

Education

  • Bachelor’s degree required, preferably with a quantitative focus (Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, Math, Economics, etc.)
  • Master’s degree preferred
  • Internships / experience in data science or related roles preferred
  • Masters degree / Bachelors + internship experience in a data science/advanced analytics role, or demonstrated ability to perform job functions via academic project/internship experience

Why You Should Work Here

At Couche-Tard/Circle K, we believe that our team members are the heart and soul of our business. When you join us, you're not just getting a job – you're becoming part of a vibrant community where your talents are valued, your growth is nurtured, and your contributions make a real difference. Here's why you'll love working with us:

Benefits Package

  • Group Insurance Program: Stay healthy and happy! Our plan provides you with the flexibility to choose coverage that best meets your needs and add optional insurance (health and dental care, long-term disability, life insurance, health spending account)
  • Pension Plan: Plan for your future and retire with peace of mind with our pension plan, helping you build a secure financial future.
  • Share Purchase Plan: Invest in your future and share in our success with our employee stock purchase plan, allowing you to become a shareholder of Circle K.
  • Paid Time Off: Recharge and rejuvenate with paid time off, including vacation days, sick days, and personal days to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance.

Additional Perks

  • Training and Development: Grow your skills and advance your career with access to ongoing training and development opportunities, including workshops, seminars, and online courses.
  • Recognition and Rewards: We celebrate our team's achievements and milestones with a range of recognition programs, rewards, and incentives to show our appreciation for your hard work and dedication.
  • Mentorship Program: Take your career to new heights with our mentorship program, where seasoned professionals provide guidance, support, and valuable insights to help you reach your full potential.
  • Scholarship Program: Invest in your education and future success with our scholarship program, available not only to our employees but also to their children. We're committed to supporting your lifelong learning journey and empowering you to achieve your academic and career goals.

INTERESTED? You are only a few clicks away from joining an exceptional company! Visit our careers page at https://workwithus.circlek.com/ca/en to submit your application. We can't wait to hear from you!

At Circle K, we're committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone is treated with respect and dignity. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life to join our team and contribute their unique perspectives and talents.

We thank all candidates for their interest in this position. Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted for further steps in the hiring process.

Circle K values diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from the following designated groups: women, aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Tripstack

We are travel tech entrepreneurs, changing the way millions of people travel.

Our proprietary Virtual Interlining (VI) technology provides access to billions of travel itineraries by combining flights from different airline carriers that don't traditionally work together. We take our customers from destination A to B via C, at the lowest possible price. We are impacting the way people travel globally and provide higher margin opportunities to our partners that are some of the largest in the travel industry.

We pride ourselves on the performance-driven environment we have created for our teams to prosper and excel in. We come to work ready, to challenge and be challenged. We're big enough to give our teams support but small enough that every person makes a difference. There are plenty of challenges to champion.

The role:

We're looking for a driven and self-starting Senior Data Analyst to join our Data team. You will contribute to our mission by leveraging analytics capabilities to improve visibility, identify opportunities for accelerating revenue growth and to drive efficiency. You will be a key member of a cross-functional Data team at Tripstack.

Requirements

Responsibilities:


Extract Insights from Large Data Sets: Analyze extensive datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive business decisions and optimize operational performance
Market Trend Analysis: Conduct thorough analyses of market trends to identify emerging opportunities for business growth and competitive advantages
KPI Development and Monitoring: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and monitor both new and existing key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with organizational goals
Data-Driven Partnership Strategies: Work closely with business development teams to apply data-driven methodologies in establishing and enhancing strategic partnerships, ensuring alignment with business objectives
Support Design and Deployment of A/B Tests: Work closely with product and data science functions to design experiments around hypotheses and implement measurement and reporting pipelines
Mentor Junior Analysts: You will provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts in the team to help them develop their analytical skills and industry knowledge. Your responsibilities will include offering constructive feedback on their work, facilitating their professional growth through training and development opportunities, and ensuring they adhere to best practices and project requirements


Desired Skills and Experience:


5+ years of experience in data analytics in travel, tech or e-commerce
Bachelor's Degree in computer science, economics, mathematics, engineering or related discipline
Demonstrated ability to work with large datasets independently
Experience in building queries in SQL, automating reporting and building analytics ETL pipelines in PySpark or related languages
Experience programming in Python, R, or related languages
Experience building self service dashboards in Looker, Power BI or other BI tools
Proven interpersonal communication skills
Proven organizational skills and experience working independently
Demonstrated willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges


Nice to have:


2+ years experience with a Master's Degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or related discipline
Desire to learn and understand business concepts / new ideas
Knowledge of statistical techniques for experimentation & hypothesis testing, regression and statistical tests
Experience working effectively with data engineering and science teams



Benefits

What it takes to succeed here

Ambition and dedication to make a difference and change the way people travel; Where we always play to each other's strength in a high performing team reaching for our common goal. We hold ourselves to the highest expectations, and move with a sense of urgency and hold ourselves accountable and win by staying true to what we believe in.

Learn more about our values here

What we offer

We offer an opportunity to work with a young, dynamic, and a growing team composed of high-caliber professionals. We value professionalism and promote a culture where individuals are encouraged to do more and be more. If you feel you share our passion for excellence, and growth, then look no further. We have an ambitious mission, and we need a world-class team to make it a reality. Upgrade to a First Class team!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Biomedical SaaS
Description:
Lumerate is growing rapidly, and we’re searching for a Data Analyst - Biomedical SaaS to join our team for the journey!




Who is Lumerate?




Lumerate is a Toronto-based SaaS company that has built game-changing technology to help sales teams accelerate revenue growth. We help our customers achieve the full picture of their industries. We also strive to achieve our own personal full pictures from a career fulfillment and learning perspective. We’re in the business of gathering intelligence about industries and delivering it to the right people within those industries through innovative software interfaces. Our vision is to be the world's most useful and trusted source of information for professionals seeking to understand what's happening in their industry. Our mission is to deliver industry awareness to an ever-increasing number of people, in whatever way helps them to make the most informed decisions, take the most immediate action and be the most awesome at their unique jobs.




This Data Analyst - Biomedical SaaS role is ideal for a recent graduate or someone looking to kickstart their career in data analysis. You’ll be responsible for data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure the highest standards of data quality and accuracy.




What you’ll be responsible for




Hunting for information on the web and within hard-to-reach datasets
Organizing and structuring unstructured data
Setting up workflows in Google Sheets
Working with LLMs (prompt engineering)
Running experiments and documenting your findings
Becoming proficient in various scripting languages
Using industrial-scale AI tools to enhance and scale your research efforts
Tracking changes within specific online data sources
Working with commercial teams to align data efforts with customer priorities




Core Skills and Experience




Bachelors (required), Masters or PhD (preference) in a biomedical field of science
You have conducted biomedical research during your career, meaning you’ve used a pipette outside of coursework (Note: While this role does not involve working in a wet lab, we are looking for someone who has hands-on lab experience)
You are proficient with medium-complexity functions in Google Sheets or Excel
You are meticulous and have a keen eye for detail
You enjoy puzzles, which is why you will find and include the word located at these coordinates 43.63565745335677, -79.43972483985826 in your cover letter




The ideal candidate




Is ultra curious about how the world works Is deeply curious about how the world works
Wants to work at an intersection of software and biology
Loves hunting for information and organizing it effectively
Values a strong and positive company culture




Why Lumerate? Fancy perks etc.




Be a part of a tightly-knit team with a thriving hybrid culture
Three weeks paid vacation + paid statutory holidays
Upgrade your home office setup with our hybrid stipend
Join us for our annual all-company retreat (past destinations include Iceland, Costa Rica, Portugal and Dominican Republic)
Earn additional paid vacation days with continued learning ($1000 annual stipend for courses and classes)
Take part in our Employee Giving Program (you choose the causes and the company provides the funds)
Basic and extended health and dental benefits + paid and topped-up maternal and parental leave for full-time employees







Salary: $65,000-$75,000 per year




Start Date: As soon as the successful candidate is available




Location: The successful candidate is based in the Greater Toronto Area, working Hybrid from home 2 days/week, while enjoying the benefits of in-person interactions at our Toronto office 3 days/week.




Already envisioning your first day at Lumerate as a Data Analyst? Apply now with your cover letter and resumé! We look forward to hearing from you. ‍Please note that any applications without a cover letter will not be considered. Candidates must be legally eligible to work in Canada.




Lumerate is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Open Systems Tech is looking for a Senior Data Analyst for one of our Financial services clients. This is a time sensitive opportunity, please apply ASAP.




Job Title: Senior Data Analyst

Location: Mississauga - 3 days - Hybrid

Term: 1 year contract plus extension




Job Description:

Strong SQL skills are essential; experience writing complex queries spanning multiple tables is required.

10+ years of experience in IT and data base/data warehouse domain.

Advanced level MS Excel and data interpretation/visualization techniques.

Strong Domain knowledge of OTC derivatives & Markets.

Exposure to scripting language like shell scripting, python is required.

Good communication and organizational skills.




Responsibilities:

The resource will be involved in working on implementation and governance of Data Quality and Controls on Cloudera/big data platform.
Working with source systems that publish transactions to Cloudera data platform and perform RCA on controls failed.
Day-to-day activity would involve working extensively on complex SQLs that are run on Hive/IMPALA DB.
Running daily/weekly reports and visualizations, Advanced excel / visualization techniques
Experience on Olympus platform (big data/cloud), data warehouse solution, big data (python/shell scripting), cloud experience, Hive, impala.
Show more

Title: Junior Analytics Developer
Description:
VERB is a digital marketing and technology agency located in downtown Halifax, Nova Scotia. Our global clients offer the opportunity to work and collaborate with some of the world's biggest destinations, resorts, and travel brands—and with our employee travel credit, it's easy to experience them for yourself. We take a balanced approach to work/life and have fun at the office- or wherever we happen to be working. We are passionate about exceeding expectations and we thrive on jobs other agencies might find too big, or too difficult, or too fast

Sound good? Great, here's who we're looking for...

The Junior Analytics Developer supports the implementation of web tracking strategies for client websites, while supporting their team with ad hoc bug fixes.

What You Will Do


Set up complete analytics tracking (Page Data, eCommerce, UX) with Google Analytics
Work with DOM elements, dataLayer events and A/B testing platforms to monitor and track events
Communicate issues/ticket updates to Analytics team and other internal stakeholders
Integrate third-party APIs and libraries
Stay on top of maintenance and bug fixes for existing interactions in the browser, session, and DOM across various platforms (marketing, ecommerce, etc.)



Requirements


0-3 years of JavaScript experience with knowledge of concepts such as, asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES5/ES6
Post-secondary education with a focus in IT Web Programming, Computer Science, or equivalent experience
Knowledge of Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, DoubleClick for Publishers, Adobe Analytics is an asset
Knowledge of code versioning (Git) and CI/CD process
Up-to-date on current web trends and standards
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication
Highly organized with the ability to function in a fast-paced business environment



Benefits

Our benefits are anything but basic, with vacation time available on day one (not to mention an extra bonus week during the holidays), an annual travel credit (for non-work related travel), and free office snacks and drinks to keep you energized when you're around.

In addition, we offer the following and are consistently looking for new ways to enhance the benefits we offer to our team:


100% premium share option for Group Health Insurance (medical, dental, vision), with a health spending account to top up your claims
A wellness spending account
Company matching RRSP program
Top up for Parental/Pregnancy leave
Remote and flexible work arrangements
Transit and fitness discounts
Recreational sports teams
Learning and development opportunities with a multitude of resources
Internal recognition programs
Show more

Title: Data Insights Analyst
Description:
Work location:

Home Office 1303 Yonge St

City:

Toronto

What you will do:

Data Insights Analyst

Hybrid position working from the Cineplex corporate office at 1303 Yonge Street, Toronto (Yonge, south of St. Clair) 3 days per week.

The Data Insights Analyst will join the Data Science & Insights team that empowers the Cineplex organization to optimize and delight the customer experience with data-informed insights and capabilities.

The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in evolving Cineplex’s ability to extract and present actionable data insights to key stakeholders in order to better understand and improve the end-to-end customer experience across Cineplex’s digital and offline channels. The Analyst is responsible for collaborating with product and design teams to support their KPIs and dashboard requirements, and communicating actionable insights to key stakeholders in order to improve the customer experience.

Key Responsibilities:

Technical & Business Expertise


Provide analytical expertise of the customer and digital data ecosystem with a strong command of data analysis techniques and data collection processes
Develop and maintain user-friendly dashboards, scorecards, and presentations that clearly highlight the actionable insights and opportunities
Understand the “big picture” and how customer and market insights tie back to business priorities


Inspiring & Influencing


Be the subject matter expert to represent the customer data and digital analytics function on cross-functional product teams
Influence and use data insights to tell stories through distilling complex concepts into simple themes that are relevant to key stakeholders, teams, and executives


Teamwork & Collaboration


Collaborate closely with a variety of product development teams to define their business and data requirements to better understand the performance and effectiveness of various strategic priorities
Gather and prioritize net new data requests from key stakeholders to the data engineering and data science teams based on business value


Education and Certification:


Bachelor’s or equivalent degrees in economics, computer science, engineering, or similar fields with a quantitative focus


Experience Needed:


3-5 years’ experience with building data models, querying/organizing large datasets, and visualizing data into dashboards (i.e. SQL/databases, Power BI, Tableau, Excel, etc.) is required.
3-5 years’ experience working with Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics is required.
3-5 years’ experience with interpreting and presenting insights to a variety of stakeholders with varying data competencies, including executives
Experience with other Adobe products is considered an asset (i.e. Target, Launch, Experience Platform)


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


High proficiency in data storytelling and presentation, written, and verbal communication skills to executives and multiple stakeholder teams
Strong planning and organizational skills with the ability to perform effectively in an environment with many competing demands
Deep understanding of market research and analytics to ensure our analytics and insights practice is the gold standard in the industry
Familiar with agile methodology and practices
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Comfortable to challenge the status quo enabling effective decision making


Inclusion & Diversity

Cineplex, its subsidiaries, and affiliates are equal opportunity employers with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable.

Accessibility

We are committed to improving access and opportunities for all individuals, including those with disabilities by identifying and removing barriers that may prevent, inhibit, or restrict their access to employment oporunities. If you require accommodation at any stage of our hiring process (application, interviews, assessments, and placement), please contact us at 416-323-6600 or via email at jobs@cineplex.com.

While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Data Insights Analyst

Hybrid position working from the Cineplex corporate office at 1303 Yonge Street, Toronto (Yonge, south of St. Clair) 3 days per week.

The Data Insights Analyst will join the Data Science & Insights team that empowers the Cineplex organization to optimize and delight the customer experience with data-informed insights and capabilities.

The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in evolving Cineplex’s ability to extract and present actionable data insights to key stakeholders in order to better understand and improve the end-to-end customer experience across Cineplex’s digital and offline channels. Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Tripstack

We are travel tech entrepreneurs, changing the way millions of people travel.

Our proprietary Virtual Interlining (VI) technology provides access to billions of travel itineraries by combining flights from different airline carriers that don't traditionally work together. We take our customers from destination A to B via C, at the lowest possible price. We are impacting the way people travel globally and provide higher margin opportunities to our partners that are some of the largest in the travel industry.

We pride ourselves on the performance-driven environment we have created for our teams to prosper and excel in. We come to work ready, to challenge and be challenged. We're big enough to give our teams support but small enough that every person makes a difference. There are plenty of challenges to champion.

The role:

We're looking for a driven and self-starting Senior Data Analyst to join our Data team. You will contribute to our mission by leveraging analytics capabilities to improve visibility, identify opportunities for accelerating revenue growth and to drive efficiency. You will be a key member of a cross-functional Data team at Tripstack.

Requirements

Responsibilities:


Extract Insights from Large Data Sets: Analyze extensive datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive business decisions and optimize operational performance
Market Trend Analysis: Conduct thorough analyses of market trends to identify emerging opportunities for business growth and competitive advantages
KPI Development and Monitoring: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and monitor both new and existing key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with organizational goals
Data-Driven Partnership Strategies: Work closely with business development teams to apply data-driven methodologies in establishing and enhancing strategic partnerships, ensuring alignment with business objectives
Support Design and Deployment of A/B Tests: Work closely with product and data science functions to design experiments around hypotheses and implement measurement and reporting pipelines
Mentor Junior Analysts: You will provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts in the team to help them develop their analytical skills and industry knowledge. Your responsibilities will include offering constructive feedback on their work, facilitating their professional growth through training and development opportunities, and ensuring they adhere to best practices and project requirements


Desired Skills and Experience:


5+ years of experience in data analytics in travel, tech or e-commerce
Bachelor's Degree in computer science, economics, mathematics, engineering or related discipline
Demonstrated ability to work with large datasets independently
Experience in building queries in SQL, automating reporting and building analytics ETL pipelines in PySpark or related languages
Experience programming in Python, R, or related languages
Experience building self service dashboards in Looker, Power BI or other BI tools
Proven interpersonal communication skills
Proven organizational skills and experience working independently
Demonstrated willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges


Nice to have:


2+ years experience with a Master's Degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or related discipline
Desire to learn and understand business concepts / new ideas
Knowledge of statistical techniques for experimentation & hypothesis testing, regression and statistical tests
Experience working effectively with data engineering and science teams



Benefits

What it takes to succeed here

Ambition and dedication to make a difference and change the way people travel; Where we always play to each other's strength in a high performing team reaching for our common goal. We hold ourselves to the highest expectations, and move with a sense of urgency and hold ourselves accountable and win by staying true to what we believe in.

Learn more about our values here

What we offer

We offer an opportunity to work with a young, dynamic, and a growing team composed of high-caliber professionals. We value professionalism and promote a culture where individuals are encouraged to do more and be more. If you feel you share our passion for excellence, and growth, then look no further. We have an ambitious mission, and we need a world-class team to make it a reality. Upgrade to a First Class team!

Title: Data Analyst - Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative
Description:
Specialisterne is Recruiting!

Specialisterne connects qualified neurodivergent candidates to employment opportunities in numerous industries and sectors in Canada and the US.

To be eligible to apply, you must have experienced barriers getting and/ or maintaining meaningful employment and you identify with one of the following:


Autism (including Asperger’s and PDD-NOS)
Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) or Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD)
Learning Disability (e.g., dyslexia, dyscalculia, dysgraphia)
Intellectual Disability
Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
Tourette Syndrome


Employees hired through Specialisterne will be supported by a Specialisterne Workplace Support Specialist for their first twelve weeks on the job.

Specialisterne is proud to partner with CIBC on a Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative.

CIBC is a leading North American financial institution. From Personal, Business and Commercial Banking to Wealth Management and Capital Markets businesses, their 44,000 employees provide a full range of financial products and services to 10 million clients in Canada, the United States and around the world.

CIBC places a high value on diversity in its workforce, recognizes the business benefits that accrue from responding to challenges from multiple perspectives, and is exercising a leadership position in the hiring of people with disabilities.

Applications must be submitted in full no later than September 3rd, 2024

Summary:

Title: Data Analyst

Employment Type: Full-Time

Hours: 8:30am-5pm

Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid, in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday)

Target Start Date: September 2024

About this Role:

You will be joining CIBC’s Optimization and Process Engineering team and be at the centre of an innovative team that develops process improvements to make the bank more efficient. As a Data Analyst you will be involved in supporting the Process Engineering and Optimization team in the identification and implementation of process improvements to enhance client experience, reduce risk and increase profitability. You will use direct client feedback as well as analysis of system data to understand the challenges of the business, improve the quality of key processes, eliminate redundant tasks and make our bank more efficient. You will work with your team to assist in opportunity identification and solution development in order to bring the bank into the future.

Essential Tasks - In this job, you will:


Support ongoing process reviews to identify issues early on and recommend solutions to business challenges
Stay on top of best practices and industry knowledge to identify process improvements that will create a best-in-class client experience
Enter and manipulate data in order to prepare it for manual or automated analysis
Learn how to utilize tools such as Excel and Alteryx to swiftly cleanse data for use in automated tools such as Blue Prism
You will support the optimization team through review and summary of large data sets in order to identify areas of opportunity for the optimization team
You will develop static data visualizations based on your analysis to summarize insights to highlight key findings for inclusion in presentations


General Skills and Abilities:


Attention to detail and critical thinking skills
Willingness to learn and adapt new processes
Effective written and visual communication skills
Goal oriented
Ability to work in a team environment
Communication and conflict resolution


Digital/Technical Skills & Tools - You are:


Intermediate skill level with Microsoft Excel
Intermediate skill level with SQL
Intermediate skill level with Python or R
Basic skill level with Tableau or Power BI
Statistical and Database Knowledge


Required skill level*


Basic - e.g., I can do this in simple situations with close or extensive guidance
Basic to Intermediate
Intermediate - e.g., I can do this in most situations, with occasional guidance
Intermediate to expert
Expert - e.g., I can do this in exceptionally difficult situations with no guidance and I can be a key resource for others


Education/Knowledge - You:


Bachelors degree in either Computer Science, Statistics, Information Security, Business or Engineering
Nice to have (but not required):
PMP Certification work in project based environments

Experience (Professional, Academic, Personal) - You:


Nice to have (but not required):
Work experience in data analytics

Additional Information:

Here’s how frequently the following types of communication and interaction are required to perform the job:


Oral communication: Daily
Email communication: Daily
Instant messaging: Daily
Telephone Communication: Daily
Video communication: Daily (Camera encouraged but optional)
Interacting with supervisors: Daily
Interacting with peers: Daily
Interacting with customers: Weekly
Selling or influencing others: Weekly
Training or teaching others: N/A


Here’s what can employees find stressful about this job:


Meeting short deadlines and being asked to turn around findings within a reduced period of time


Here’s what employees tend to find motivating/rewarding about this job:


Using data to provide clarity to our supporting partners to help make informed decisions


Workplace Support:


Specialisterne and our employer partners are committed to providing inclusive onboarding experiences and supporting new employees as they learn on the job
All new hires continue to liaise with a Specialisterne Workplace Support Specialist for their first twelve weeks on the job


The Recruitment Process

To be considered for this position, you will:


Complete a job application
Join our talent pool (if you haven’t already) by completing an additional questionnaire and a pre-employment assessment


Next Steps


Successful applicants will create a job-specific Candidate Profile to answer job specific questions and/or complete a work sample exercise to showcase your skills for this role
Employers use Candidate Profiles to anonymously* shortlist candidates
Candidates and employers will meet to discuss the role in more detail
whenever possible

Title: Manufacturing Data Analyst
Description:
Who is Litens?

We are a diverse group of talented people committed to creating solutions to problems and making the world a better place. We enhance and deliver both mechanical and electrified solutions that bring efficiency and sustainability to new heights. Founded in 1979, Litens has a proud history of being an innovative and highly respected company specializing in powertrain system engineering and component supply. Our history includes numerous achievements, many of which have been recognized through prestigious awards from our customers.

Experience a fulfilling and supportive environment where ingenuity is rewarded, collaboration is encouraged, and opportunities are readily available.




Why Join Litens?

Join the Litens Manufacturing Operations Team as a Manufacturing Improvement Analyst. At Litens, you can make an impact. We’ve purposefully cultivated a supportive and flexible environment that gives everyone the opportunity to succeed. Litens offers a competitive and people-first approach to compensation and benefits, and we are committed to provide balanced employment and advancement opportunities for everyone.

Our diversity is our source of strength. At Litens, we are committed to equal employment opportunity, and we value and welcome diversity. We respect employees’ rights for a safe and respectful workplace. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.




What will you do?

Gather and diagnose historical Manufacturing data from various sources related to Process, Materials, Labour, or Overhead and present opportunities for improvement.
Maintain status of labour, NVA, and scrap costs for monthly reconciliation with accounting
Monitor Shoplogix MES data and work with Business Systems/IT/Production to maintain accuracy and integrity
Balance support towards evaluation, research, and analysis between shop floor and office processes
Benchmark current business practices against World Class processes and present opportunities to management for improvement
Monitor Work Center performance to expected standards and communicate any variances to production leadership and Lean Manager
Participate and support CI related activities (kaizen, VSM, Materials PFEP, CI projects) by supplying performance data and hands on practical assistance.
Leverage your expert Excel skills for analysis of Manufacturing Operations data and potential improvement
Provides performance data for bench marking exercises within Litens global facilities.
Manage and maintain annual changes to Litens Production System Assessment (LPSA)
Work with Maintenance and Setup teams and leaders to facilitate administrative machine related Preventative Maintenance improvements




What will you bring?

University degree in Business or Engineering
4 years automotive/manufacturing experience
Proven ability to navigate, gather and analyze data through various business systems such as MS D365 Finance and Operations, and others, with a high degree of competence
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, intermediate skills with Word and Power Point
Proven ability to diagnose manufacturing data for the purpose of identifying and quantifying business opportunities and propose alternative improvement solutions
Requirement to maintain confidentiality is critical to this role
Experience with Lean Manufacturing principles and concepts
Flexible to work between local plants if necessary

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Akkodis is seeking a Senior Data Analyst for a contract position with a client in Toronto Downtown ON (Hybrid). Ideally looking for strong experience with Collibra or IGC of data flows within a large enterprise. Experience in data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules using IGC (Information Governance Console) and universal catalogue and developing dashboards in PowerBI and Tableau. would be an added asset preferred would be someone with Canadian Banking/Insurance experience.




Title - Senior Data Analyst (Collibra or IGC)

Location- Toronto ON (Hybrid) Hybrid (minimum once a week)

Contract




Candidate Must-Have Skills:

1. 10+ years of working experience as a Data Analyst with a strong understanding of data concepts (metadata, data mapping, data quality, data modeling, data governance).

2. Hands-on experience working within Data Management and Operations, including proficiency in Data Management Tools (Collibra and IGC preferred) and understanding of data flows within a large enterprise.

3. Working knowledge of Data Management framework and can trace data elements at origination and as they move between systems including any transformations.

4. Working knowledge of data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules using IGC (Information Governance Console) and universal catalogue.

5. Hands-on experience with developing dashboards in PowerBI and Tableau.




Nice-To-Have Skills:

Strong business acumen, data analysis, metadata documentation, and data quality controls skills specifically with respect to analyzing business process controls, sourcing, and provisioning of lineage, identifying data quality issues and proposing remediation steps.• Understanding of Banks systems i.e. ALM6, IGC, GC.

• Demonstrated ability to provide evidence to 2nd and 3rd line.

• Understanding or experience with Treasury.

• Cloud platforms and related data services knowledge (e.g., Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services).

2. Hands-on experience working within Data Management and Operations, including proficiency in Data Management Tools (Collibra and IGC preferred) and understanding of data flows within a large enterprise.

3. Working knowledge of Data Management framework and can trace data elements at origination and as they move between systems including any transformations.

4. Working knowledge of data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules using IGC (Information Governance Console) and universal catalogue.

5. Hands-on experience with developing dashboards in PowerBI and Tableau.


Nice-To-Have Skills:

Strong business acumen, data analysis, metadata documentation, and data quality controls skills specifically with respect to analyzing business process controls, sourcing, and provisioning of lineage, identifying data quality issues and proposing remediation steps.• Understanding of Banks systems i.e. ALM6, IGC, GC.

• Demonstrated ability to provide evidence to 2nd and 3rd line.

• Understanding or experience with Treasury.

• Cloud platforms and related data services knowledge (e.g., Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services).

Title: Business Data Analyst, Retro Admin
Description:
PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.

We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!

Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.

PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.

Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.



Job Description



About this job:

The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for the analysis, development, and support of all outgoing client data files for processing in PartnerRe systems. Data is produced in various file formats and usually includes transaction, in force, valuation and underwriting files, which have process streams that vary by function.

Support the PartnerRe monthly retro billing process (including account and data reconciliations, exception handling, account booking).
Update accounting system to track retro premium and commission accounts. Find and correct any discrepancies.
Identify/present variances, account trending, premium calculations/verifications and draw conclusions from the findings.
Ensure monthly retro processing continue to meet stated metrics. Responsibilities include data/plan mapping (including entry and verification of manual data loads) for all clients, investigation and resolution of client issues, and accounting loads/verification.
Create, maintain and test the ETL scripts used for acquiring, transforming and loading into PartnerRe systems/tools.
Analyze and design management reporting as defined by management. Write VBA code, macros, and SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and distribute data.
Document all TAI processes and procedures put into production.
Adhere to all IT controls and security established by IT management.
Ensure the Team Lead is informed of ongoing work activities and any unusual circumstances to ensure quality and timely deliverables.
Assist other teams within North American Life Operations when necessary including, claims, assumed and reporting teams.
Assist Valuation and Pricing with requests for data and data inquiries. Analyzing discrepancies and providing documentation.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, initiate internal reports and create efficiencies to improve data quality.
Liaise with Underwriting for data checking, management reporting, and discussion on results for Retro business (including facultative applications).
Assist with Enhancement Projects including creation of project, testing and preparation for deployment. Defect/bug discovery and acceptance testing for the administration system. Document testing and outcomes and liaise with other departments to ensure tasks and bugs are completed to specifications.
Participation in client visits.
Communicate with clients to facilitate transmission of monthly transaction files and address any questions/clarifications regarding data issues with clients.
Support client audits (desk and on-site audits).


Qualifications



About you:

The successful candidate should be a conscientious individual with exceptional problem-solving skills and a high degree of professional ethics and intellectual curiosity. In addition, the candidate should be a well-rounded individual who possesses the right combination of communication skills, an inquiring mind and creative mindset.

Qualifications and Experience

1-4 years of experience in a financial institution with some data management expertise
1-3 years of TAI Experience
Knowledge of insurance industry is a plus
Undergraduate or Graduate degree in business or STEM disciplines
Basic knowledge of audit & quality assurance principles
Interpersonal skills and relationship management
Proficient in SQL, MS Office, Alteryx
Some experience with VBA
Basic French language skills is a plus


Additional Information



PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.

Thank you,

PartnerRe Hiring Team

Title: Business Analytics Analyst
Description:
Range

53,600.00 - 80,400.00 CAD

Job Description

Business Analytics Analyst

GAME ON – OLG needs you

We’ve said GAME ON, and we mean it – OLG is rapidly transforming its organization to better serve Ontarians by delivering great gaming experiences through our digital, retail lottery, and land-based gaming channels. Over the course of fiscal 2022-23, OLG delivered a record $2.5 billion in net profit to the Province of Ontario. OLG is now expanding our horizons even further, with a new strategic direction, to become a world class gaming entertainment leader with a globally admired digital platform.

We are ready to take this game to the next level and need a passionate Business Analytics Analyst to be a key resource for the advancement of analytic fact-based decision making within the OLG. Pursuing innovative analytical techniques will be an everyday part of managing sensitive customer, operational, financial, digital and other non-financial data as a strategic resource. This position requires significant capacity to manage multiple competing objectives and a flair for communicating technical, often complex information in understandable terms to significantly different audiences.

YOUR ROLE IN THE GAME

Reporting to the Director Business Analytics, you will be empowered to:


Support analytical initiatives, projects and deliverables related to Responsible Gambling
Proactively monitor and analyze customer and operational performance within Responsible Gambling and identify insights and areas of opportunity.
Analyze customer behaviour and RG Program performance and assist in developing and evaluating RG programming strategies and tactics, including AB testing performance
Develop analytical plans, reports and dashboards
Execute and maintain regular RG reporting, including weekly and quarterly reports and dashboards
Monitor published customer and operational data and take action/ownership to ensure accuracy, consistency, relevance and timeliness of the information.
Query big data though our Hadoop data lake using SQL and Python
Create support documentation for analysis findings, presentations, reports, templates, etc.
Work with key stakeholders to understand relevant business opportunities and propose analytics-based solutions to the business challenges, often working & collaborating closely with other teams across the organization.
Manage, prioritize, and respond to ad-hoc data requests
Optimize data workflows to automate ETL processes and increase speed of delivery for analytical outputs.
Proactively collaborate across the enterprise with different business units to solve challenging data and research problems.
Communicate with key stakeholders at all levels to translate complex concepts into actionable insights.



Work Experience

WHAT YOU NEED TO PLAY


2 or more years of experience in an analytical role.
Experience working with BI reporting tools and statistical software.
Experience working with Hadoop and related big data technologies.
Experience building, updating and explaining data analysis and advanced analytical techniques.
Experience wrangling, cleaning and automating disparate data sources to power analytical outputs.
Experience in preparing and writing results or research reports



Education: A University degree in business/commerce, statistics, computer science, economics, finance or mathematics. Knowledge of key languages and platforms such as: Power BI, Python, Alteryx, SQL, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, GA 360, Excel, SPSS

Critical Skills


Technical skills: BI dashboard & reporting tools and data management and analytics software
Data translation: ability to identify, apply, and explain analytical and statistical concepts for a business challenges and audience.
Collaboration: comfortable reaching out and collaborating across a large organization
Results driven and an effective self-starter with excellent interpersonal skills who thrives in an environment that demands teamwork.
Communicate effectively to non-technical audience in a succinct and compelling manner.



Strategic Thinker: strong strategic and critical thinker with ability to delve into unique challenges and find creative solutions

Collaboration & Fun: inclusive and collaborative work style while creating fun and excitement in our work

Integrity and Trust: do what's right and operate with transparency and openness

PERKS OF JOINING OUR TEAM


Part of a Bigger Picture: socially responsible company that gives back all its profits to the province and people of Ontario
Flexible Work Environment: to help balance both work and life
You Matter: family friendly work practices and hybrid work
Freedom to Innovate: supports new and better ways to be successful
Be your Authentic Self: environment that values diversity as a source of strength
Learning Galore: 24-7 access to robust online learning programs
Public Service Pension Plan: participate in a major defined benefit pension plan sponsored by the Government of Ontario
Variable Pay Program: performance-based incentives to share in our success (Permanent OLG Employees Only)



Learn about OLG – GAME ON!

OLG’s purpose is to contribute to a better Ontario by delivering great entertainment experiences for our customers. We are a multi-billion-dollar organization with a wide array of business lines including, lottery, land-based casinos, digital lottery and casino, horseracing, and charitable gaming. OLG is amidst a massive transformation focusing on being customer obsessed and bringing our digital business to a whole new level.

The key to our success is our people. Our culture will be grounded in true, positive partnerships that embrace trust, clarity, and openness in all that we do. We are supporting and empowering employees and teams across the organization through greater accountability, leadership development and growth opportunities. OLG is embracing more flexible work options and family friendly work practices including hybrid work.

Equity, diversity, and inclusion are essential elements of our culture and cornerstones of the Five Truths that OLGers Live by. At OLG, our employees have the space to be themselves and use their perspectives and skills to benefit the people and the Province of Ontario.

While we are re-shaping and growing our business, we are unwavering when it comes to living our purpose, and ensuring our business delivers meaningful benefits for the people of Ontario. OLG’s net profits are reinvested back into the province, contributing to the quality of life for Ontarians.

To learn more about OLG go to our website at www.olg.ca

We look forward to hearing from you, interested applicants please apply online by September 3, 2024.

OLG is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Please contact Human Resources at careers@olg.ca if you require accommodation at any time throughout the hire process.

We thank you for your interest in this opportunity; however only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

Personal information is collected by the Ontario Lottery & Gaming Corporation (OLG) and/or its third party service provider(s) under the authority of the Ontario Lottery and Gaming Corporation Act, 1999, SO 1999, c 12, Sch L and the Employment Standards Act, 2000, S.O. 2000, c. 41 (as amended) and will be used for the purpose of determining qualifications for employment with OLG and for recruitment modernization initiatives. The information will be managed in accordance with all applicable laws, OLG’s Protection of Privacy Policy (the Policy) and related policies and procedures. For any questions about this collection, please contact careers@olg.ca, 800-70 Foster Drive, Sault Ste. Marie, ON, P6A 6V2.

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
Company Description

At Neilson, we’re dedicated to helping families secure financial protection for their loved ones with a range of life insurance options.

Neilson is a leading provider of innovative, simple and great-value direct life insurance products.

We have evolved from our origins in the UK, where the business was launched in 2012, to become an award-winning international operation and leader in the global life insurance market. Today, we have offices in the USA, Canada, Ireland, and Australia.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior SQL Developer to join our Data Engineering team.

This Team Is Responsible For


Designing, developing, and implementing database solutions for the organization’s various sales, CRM, and lead management applications and systems.
Maintaining the code base through Database Lifecycle Management.
Developing and maintaining ETL solutions and data pipelines.
Ensuring smooth and consistent day-to-day operations of the database environment.
Troubleshooting and resolving database issues.


As a member of the team, the ideal candidate will be expected to:


Develop and maintain tables, stored procedures, functions, and other objects.
Liaise with business partners and key stakeholders to understand requirements and design effective solutions.
Have a strong understanding of Microsoft SQL products and the Azure cloud platform.
Possess excellent troubleshooting skills.Have excellent communication skills.


Key Responsibilities


Production Code Development:
Write and maintain production-level code to support lead management and CRM applications and systems, ensuring scalability, performance, and reliability.
Collaborate with software developers to integrate SQL components seamlessly into applications.
Data Extraction and Transformation:
Design and develop data pipelines for efficient data extraction and transformation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and ensure accurate and timely delivery of BI solutions.
Performance Tuning and Support:
Monitor and optimize database performance, identifying and resolving bottlenecks and inefficiencies.
Conduct regular reviews of SQL code and queries for performance improvements.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience as a SQL Analyst / Developer with a focus on BI and production-level code.
Strong proficiency in SQL, T-SQL, and experience working with relational databases (e.g. SQL Server).
Knowledge of software development best practices and the ability to write production-level performant SQL code.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.


Preferred Skills


Knowledge of data modeling and database design principles.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS).
Programming skills in languages such as C# or Python.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).


If you are a self-motivated individual with a passion for data and code, and you thrive in a dynamic and collaborative environment, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to contribute to our Business Intelligence and development initiatives.

Additional Information

If you are passionate about making a difference, you thrive in a fast paced and entrepreneurial environment and you want to be a part of a high performing team, we would love to hear from you!

Accessibility For Job Applicants

We strive to make our job application process accessible to all individuals, including those with disabilities. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application, interview, or selection process, please contact our Human Resources department. Our team will work with you to provide suitable accommodations to ensure your participation.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Neilson Financial Services is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and abilities. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is fundamental to our company culture.

Title: Data Analysis and Database Specialist
Description:
Data, Research and Evaluation

Full Time, Permanent

Hybrid

Level 7

Covenant House helps youth ignite their potential and reclaim their lives. As Canada’s largest agency serving youth who are homeless, trafficked or at risk, we offer the widest range of services to hundreds of young people every day.

More than a place to stay, we provide life-changing care with unconditional love and respect. We meet youth’s immediate needs and then we work together to achieve their future goals. We offer 24/7 crisis shelter transitional housing options on-site and, in the community, health and well-being support, training and skill development, and ongoing care once youth move into the community.

For over 40 years, Covenant House has been dedicated to its mission of serving youth on the street and to protect and safeguard all youth with absolute respect and unconditional love. Since 1982, Covenant House has supported more than 100,000 young people.

Overview


Reporting to the Efforts to Outcomes (ETO) Supervisor, the successful applicant will be responsible for:
Creating and generating reports using ETO client information system
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing extracts, reports, and performance indicators to identify and resolve problems, including data quality, integrity issues following data governance policies
Coordinates and prepares comprehensive data analysis and statistical reports for research, evaluation, policy, program and service activities
Using statistical analysis software to lead the development and delivery of functional analytics to support evidence-based decision-making.
Working with the department leads, Program Directors, and other relevant staff, ensure that the agency regularly reviews efforts towards outputs/outcomes (e.g., values, number of efforts, times spent)
Review all custom and standard reports for accuracy and timeliness so that the database maintains real time information about program participants and ensures that the agency has a process in place for a regular review conducted by appropriate staff (e.g., program manager)
Working with department leads to develop and maintain Policies, Standards and Controls about the safety of data in regard to regulatory compliance
Building advanced data visualizations (Tableau reports, infographics, scorecards, dashboards) that will support the dissemination of administrative data including outcomes and key performance indicators
Providing well-structured reports and documents to convey analysis and insights that are clear, concise and reader-friendly
Managing critical timelines and ensuring that deadlines are met
Performing other duties as required


Qualifications


The successful candidate will be a team player who has excellent communication and problem-solving skills. Their analytical ability and attention to detail coupled with their ability to prioritize and manage competing deadlines is a must.
Familiarity with ETO (Efforts to Outcomes) or another case management database is an asset.
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably within Computer Science, Statistics or approved equivalent combination of education and experience, with minimum two year’s experience in data analysis and management- including database design and advanced report writing using Structured Query Language (SQL) and other relational databases.
Experience with ETO, Tableau, and/or Qualtrics considered an asset
Experience with statistical software (e.g. R, SPSS)
Fluency in a programming language (e.g. Python) and or other programming languages would be an asset.
Proven passion for the data quality discipline
Strong interpersonal skills
Extremely meticulous in approach to work and attention to detail
Ability to work independently and within a team setting
Proven ability to meet established deadlines
Ability to quickly learn new tasks
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to multi-task and work on multiple projects simultaneously


Interested candidates should submit their cover letter and resume to this posting. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

At Covenant House Toronto we believe in a workplace culture of inclusion that is welcoming, respectful and safe for all staff. It is critical to Covenant House Toronto success to eliminate barriers and promote the inclusion of equity groups. Equity groups have been, and continue to be, underrepresented and marginalized in the workforce, leadership roles, and in some specific occupations. Equity groups include but may not be limited to Indigenous persons, racialized people, gender diverse people, 2SLGBTQIA+ people, and people with disabilities.

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Covenant House Policy on Accommodation, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of the Covenant House recruitment process.

Please visit our careers page to see more job opportunities.
